page.title: 12The Dover Motel
page.content: Opened in November 1978 and is a direct result of the decision to build a by-pass. It is the joint venture of Townsend Thoreson Ferries and Hammonds garage. The motel is situated 2 miles from Dover and built on land adjoining the by-pass. The motel provides a 24 hour service and accomodation for about 200 guests. Most people stay for one night only and 51% are British. The busiest period is June to September each year. The motel gives employment to about 78 people and jobs include receptionist, restaurant supervisor, kitchen stewards, gardeners, porters and accoutants. The restaurant provides top quality formal meals and the cafe serves snacks or full meals on a more informal basis from 1000 to 2300 hours daily.
